11243Transition Metal ChemistryTransition Met Chem0340-42851572-901XKluwer Academic PublishersDordrechtPIPS5379114911410.1007/s11243-004-9114-1ArticleSyntheses, crystal structures, and cytochrome P450-like hydroxylation property of two novel copper(II) complexesYouZhong-Lu1LiuWei-Sheng1ZhuHai-Liang2FunHoong-Kun3grid.32566.340000000085710482Department of ChemistryLanzhou University730000LanzhouP.R.Chinagrid.459531.f0000000104698037Department of ChemistryFuyang Normal CollegeQinghe East Road 741236041Fuyang AnhuiP.R.Chinagrid.11875.3a0000000122943534X-ray Crystallography Unit, School of PhysicsUniversity Sains Malaysia11800 USMPenangMalaysia02200530114100620040803200427042004© Springer 20052005Abstract

Two new copper(II) complexes, [Cu2 (Phen)2 (μ2 -OH)2 ((HCO)3) 2 ][Cu2 (Phen) 2 (μ 2 -OH)2 (H2 O)2](dhba)2 .8H2 O (1) and [(bz)4 Cu3 (μ2-OH)2 (ppz)]n(2) (where Phen = 1,10-phenanthroline, dhba = 2,6-dihydroxy-benzoate anion, bz = benzoate anion, and ppz = piperazine), have been synthesized and characterized by elemental analyses, i.r. and single crystal X-ray diffraction. Complex (1) is a tetra-nuclear CuII compound; each CuII atom in the complex has a square-pyramidal geometry, being coordinated by two nitrogen atoms and three oxygen atoms. Complex (2) is a trinuclear CuII compound. The Cu1 atom in the complex has a slightly distorted square plane, being coordinated by four oxygen atoms, while the Cu2 atom has a severely distorted square pyramid geometry, being coordinated by four oxygen atoms and one nitrogen atom. The determination studied by GC/MS analysis indicated that complex (1) has good catalytic activity for the dioxygen oxidization of cyclohexane.

elements.content: Two new copper(II) complexes, [Cu2 (Phen)2 (μ2 -OH)2 ((HCO)3) 2 ][Cu2 (Phen) 2 (μ 2 -OH)2 (H2 O)2](dhba)2 .8H2 O (1) and [(bz)4 Cu3 (μ2-OH)2 (ppz)]n(2) (where Phen = 1,10-phenanthroline, dhba = 2,6-dihydroxy-benzoate anion, bz = benzoate anion, and ppz = piperazine), have been synthesized and characterized by elemental analyses, i.r. and single crystal X-ray diffraction. Complex (1) is a tetra-nuclear CuII compound; each CuII atom in the complex has a square-pyramidal geometry, being coordinated by two nitrogen atoms and three oxygen atoms. Complex (2) is a trinuclear CuII compound. The Cu1 atom in the complex has a slightly distorted square plane, being coordinated by four oxygen atoms, while the Cu2 atom has a severely distorted square pyramid geometry, being coordinated by four oxygen atoms and one nitrogen atom. The determination studied by GC/MS analysis indicated that complex (1) has good catalytic activity for the dioxygen oxidization of cyclohexane.
elements.clean_text:
Abstract

Two new copper(II) complexes, [Cu2 (Phen)2  (μ2 -OH)2 ((HCO)3) 2 ][Cu2 (Phen) 2 (μ 2 -OH)2 (H2 O)2](dhba)2 .8H2 O (1) and [(bz)4 Cu3 (μ2-OH)2 (ppz)]n(2) (where Phen  =  1,10-phenanthroline, dhba  =  2,6-dihydroxy-benzoate anion, bz  =  benzoate anion, and ppz  =  piperazine), have been synthesized and characterized by elemental analyses, i.r. and single crystal X-ray diffraction. Complex (1) is a tetra-nuclear CuII  compound; each CuII atom in the complex has a square-pyramidal geometry, being coordinated by two nitrogen atoms and three oxygen atoms. Complex (2) is a trinuclear CuII compound. The Cu1 atom in the complex has a slightly distorted square plane, being coordinated by four oxygen atoms, while the Cu2 atom has a severely distorted square pyramid geometry, being coordinated by four oxygen atoms and one nitrogen atom. The determination studied by GC/MS analysis indicated that complex (1) has good catalytic activity for the dioxygen oxidization of cyclohexane.

metadata.title: Syntheses, crystal structures, and cytochrome P450-like hydroxylation property of two novel copper(II) complexes
